definition: see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: Nothing wrong price war, price competition is the first competition in the market.
sentences.chinese: 價格戰本無可厚非，價格競爭是第一位的市場競爭。

sentences.english: These concerns are both perfectly legitimate issues for China to raise.
sentences.chinese: 站在中國的立場上，提出這些疑慮無可厚非。

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu Corrected the left-wing three times during the period of the Great revolution which is reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 大革命時期陳獨秀的三次糾“左”皆是無可厚非的。

sentences.english: There’s nothing wrong with giving away a free resource in exchange for someone’s email address.
sentences.chinese: 贈送免費資源交換某人的郵件地址是無可厚非了。

sentences.english: Looked from the gambling angle that Shenhua this act is certainly undisputable .
sentences.chinese: 從博弈的角度看，申花此舉當然無可厚非。

sentences.english: The industry will be held to a high standard and it should be.
sentences.chinese: 核能行業將需要達到高標準，這無可厚非。

sentences.english: That’s one thing for which we don’t blame him, considering the state of national airline Air Koryo.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於朝鮮高麗航空公司的狀況，我們對他也無可厚非。

sentences.english: The captain's behaviour is above/beyond reproach.

sentences.chinese: 就外表而言，這是完全無可厚非的。

sentences.english: Contest price ranks the profit pattern that is Baidu, to this, this give no cause for more criticism.
sentences.chinese: 競價排名是百度的盈利模式，對此，本無可厚非。

sentences.english: Essentially speaking gifting red envelopes is beyond reproach.
sentences.chinese: 從本質上來說，發紅包無可厚非。
商家的促銷行爲本身無可厚非。

sentences.english: To be sure, China's efforts to develop a modernized, deployable fleet are not entirely unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 當然，中國發展現代化海軍的努力無可厚非。

sentences.english: Now on the surface, there's nothing wrong with me having a little fun.
sentences.chinese: 從表面上看，我尋求一點娛樂的做法是無可厚非的。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
requirement/necessary condition (math)
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
political position
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
in short/in a word/in brief
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
political correctness/politically correct
in other words
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
